definition: Shichahai, scenic area of northwest Beijing with three lakes
ten (used in fractions, writing checks etc)/assorted/miscellaneous
Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 剎多羅, Sanskrit ksetra)
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: A pair of lovers in Shichahai, yes…
sentences.chinese: 昨日，在什刹海，一对情侣在雪景中缠绵。

sentences.english: Later he left Simin Martial Arts Institution and was invited to Shenshahai Sports School as a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 后从四民武术研究社被邀请到什刹海体校任教。

sentences.english: Shi Shahai retained the edge of many ancient streets.
sentences.chinese: 什刹海边上留存着许多古老的街道。

sentences.english: Two girls rent a bicycle for a lake-round visit at famous tourist scene, Shichahai, in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 什刹海，两个女孩儿租了自行车准备环湖游玩。

sentences.english: Shi Shahai now is not only the public park, and attract many tourists.
sentences.chinese: 现在的什刹海不仅是市民的乐园，也吸引许多观光客。

sentences.english: Shichahai is not far away from here. We can get there by taxi.
sentences.chinese: 什刹海离这儿不太远，我们可以打车去。

sentences.english: First group is affiliated Shichahai real estate companies.
sentences.chinese: 第一家是集团下属的什刹海房地产公司。

sentences.english: A foreign guest kicking a shuttlecock outside the Lotus Market.
sentences.chinese: 在什刹海荷花市场，一名老外正在踢毽子。

sentences.english: In 1967, Zhao Wenliang moved to Shichahai.

definition: Houhai, a lake and the area surrounding it in central Beijing
Jingshan (name of a hill in Jingshan park)
Yongdingmen, front gate of the outer section of Beijing's old city wall, torn down in the 1950s and reconstructed in 2005
Daming Lake in Jinan 濟南|济南[Ji3 nan2], Shandong
